edu.stanford.nlp.lm

Class SRILanguageModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.lm.SRILanguageModel

  • public class SRILanguageModel
extends Object
    Language model class using SRILM native code.
    Author:
    Steven Bethard, Michel Galley

      Load a language model from the given file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SRILanguageModel

        public SRILanguageModel(File file)
        Load a language model from the given file.
        Parameters:
        file - An ARPA backoff N-gram model format file.

    • Method Detail

      • getOrder

        public int getOrder()
        Get the language model order, i.e. the size of an N-gram.
        Returns:
        The size of an N-gram.

      • getWordLogProb

        public double getWordLogProb(List<String> words)
        Determine the log-probability of the last word given the preceding words: This is the same as getWordLogProb(List, int), but using the maximum size of N-gram supported by the model.
        Parameters:
        words - A list of words.
        Returns:
        The log-probability (base 10).

      • getWordLogProb

        public double getWordLogProb(List<String> words,
                    int order)
        Determine the log-probability of the last word given the preceding N - 1 words: log10(P(wn|wn-1, ...))
        Parameters:
        words - The list of words.
        order - The size of N-gram to use, that is, one more than the number of preceding words to consider. Must be no greater than the order (getOrder()) of the model.
        Returns:
        The log-probability (base 10).

      • getSentenceLogProb

        public double getSentenceLogProb(List<String> words)
        Determine the log-probability of the sentence. This is the same as getSentenceLogProb(List, int), but using the maximum size of N-gram supported by the model.
        Parameters:
        words - The words in the sentence.
        Returns:
        The log-probability (base 10).

      • getSentenceLogProb

        public double getSentenceLogProb(List<String> words,
                        int order)
        Determine the log-probability of the sentence. SRILM inserts special start and end symbols, <s> and </s>, and then calculates this as: log10(P(w1 | <s>)) + log10(P(w2 | w1, ...)) + log10(P(w3 | w2, ...)) + ... log10(P(</s> | wn, ...)
        Parameters:
        words - The words in the sentence.
        order - The size of N-gram to use, that is, one more than the number of preceding words to consider. Must be no greater than the order (getOrder()) of the model.
        Returns:
        The log-probability (base 10).

      • backoffCount

        public int backoffCount(List<String> words)
        Determine how many times SRILM needs to backoff in an n-gram before it finds an n-gram present in the language model.
        Parameters:
        words - The specified n-gram.
        Returns:
        A value between 0 and list.size(), inclusive. The function returns 0 if the given n-gram is present in the language model, and it returns words.size() if the last element of the list is an OOV word.
